thig9.1:0.3: Verses of the Elder Vaḍḍha’s Mother
thig9.1:1.2: in the endless thicket of the world.
thig9.1:1.3: Oh little child, do not take part in suffering
thig9.1:2.3: They have become cool and tamed,
thig9.1:3.1: That path walked by the seers
thig9.1:3.3: leading to the end of suffering:
thig9.1:4.4: there is no thicket to be found in you.”
thig9.1:5.3: whether inferior, superior, or in the middle,
thig9.1:6.4: and completed the teaching of the Buddha.”
thig9.1:7.2: spurred me with a noble goad,
thig9.1:8.3: I was met with a sense of urgency to practice the Dhamma
thig9.1:8.4: for the attainment of safety from bondage.
thig9.1:9.1: With a mind bent upon striving,
thig9.1:9.2: active by day and by night,
thig9.1:11.1: The Chapter of the Nines is finished.
